channel.title: Need help with new idea
channel.description:
O.K. well, i have an idea for helping with rule breakers on servers. but i jsut started coding again so i really forgot a lot. im smarter than a lot of people at coding yet but not as good as i used to be. i'm using deltascape source so thats what these questions are about.
so, heres my idea, mods up can use a command that is ::warning (playername) then it sends them a message. "You have just been given a warning, you know have (getwarningamount) warnings. then when you have 2 warnings, and get another warning, your account gets banned. also, i would like to make it so when you log in it says. you currently have (getwarningamount) warnings, get 3 and you get banned, i can do that, but i need to know how to get the (getwarningsamount) so. what i need help with is-
How to put in so when you open character file it has warning = 0 or how ever many you have (like when you open has playerrights and whatnot) How to get (getwarningamount) How to make the command for ::warning (playername) How to make it so when you have 2 and get another it adds your name to banlist How to make it send the player a message when he gets a warning.
Thank you, this is well thought out, and pretty well typed out. so Please help. If you need any extra information please let me know. thanks.

item.title: Need help with new idea
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Add this in the initialize method;

if (warnings == 3) { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; } if (warnings > 0) { sM("You currently have "+warnings+" out of 3 Blackmarks."); }

@trevor267 wrote:

hmmm for some reason it says 0 warning no matter what, even though i made a guys warning 2 and made it so when you log in it shows how many you have. when i log in as that character, it says i have the correct amount, but no matter how many times i warn it doesnt show the right amount or add one?

EDIT: also when i log back in it shows the correct amount of warnings, and since i warned twice and he had 2, 4 lol and its not banned :S i ddint add the appendtoban since somone said i didnt need. should i add that?

item.title: Need help with new idea
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“warn”) && playerRights >= 2) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(5);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

		if (otherPIndex != -1) {
			client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

			sM("You have warned "+p.playerName+"!");
			p.sM("you now have "+ warnings +" warnings, you were warned by " + playerName);
			p.warnings++;
			p.savegame(true);
		} else { 
			sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
		}
	} catch (Exception e) { 
		sM("Try entering a name you want to give a warning too");
	}
}[/code]

Usage; ::warn playerName

Read full topic

case 2: if (token.equals("character-height")) { heightLevel = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-posx")) { toX = Integer.parseInt(token2) == -1 ? 2999 : Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-posy")) { toY = Integer.parseInt(token2) == -1 ? 3377 : Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-rights")) { playerRights = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-lastconnection")) { playerLastConnect = token2; } else if (token.equals("character-special")) { specialAmount = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-tz")) { TzWave = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-starter")) { starter = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-pouch1")) { smallPouch = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-pouch2")) { mediumPouch = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-q7")) { q7 = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-q8")) { q8 = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-q9")) { q9 = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-q10")) { q10 = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-q11")) { q11 = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-brightness")) { brightness = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-fighttype")) { FightType = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-skill")) { SkillID = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-chat")) { splitChat = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-ancients")) { playerAncientMagics = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-pin")) { bankPin = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-saradomin")) { saraKills = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-retaliate")) { autoRetaliate = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-action")) { action = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-pcpoints")) { pcPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-assault")) { assaultKills = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-donator")) { donator = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-bow")) { arrowsLeft = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-shield")) { shieldLeft = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-warn")) { warnings = Integer.parseInt(token2); } break;

item.title: Need help with new idea
item.dc:creator: @izzygoo izzygoo
item.description:
@izzygoo wrote:

Yet again he wasnt trying to spoonfeed you so you would use Ctrl + f to search for this:

characterfile.write("character-pouch1

Add this among those others:

characterfile.write("character-warn = ", 0, 19);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(warnings), 0, Integer.toString(largePouch).length());
characterfile.newLine();

Then see if you can do the last step using the same way of doing it I did.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with new idea
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Prima, post:10, topic:248735”]Declare:

public int warnings;

In process:

if (warnings >= 3) { appendToBanned(playerName); }

Command:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“warnplayer”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String otherPlayer = command.substring(8);
int otherPlayerIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPlayer);

	if (otherPlayerIndex != -1) {
		client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
                    sendMessage("You have given " + otherPName + " a warning.");
                    p.sendMessage("You have been warned by "+ playerName +", you now have "+ warnings +" warnings.");
                    p.warnings += 1;
		p.savemoreinfo();
            }

}[/code]

Savemoreinfo:

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-warn = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(warnings), 0, Integer.toString(warnings).length());

Loadmoreinfo:

if (token.equals("character-warn")) { warnings = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

Post back and tell me if it works, I’ve just briefly written that up.[/quote]

There are many faults in your code.

First, since the variable warnings is not being accessed from another class, it does need to be declared public.
Second, checking warnings every 500 milliseconds is unnecessary. Warnings should be checked as soon as they are issued.
And finally, you are telling the player how many warnings they have before incrementing their warnings (which by the way can be done using warnings++ rather than warnings += 1).

Nothing serious, but should be fixed nonetheless.

Read full topic

int otherPlayerIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPlayer);

	if (otherPlayerIndex != -1) {
		client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
                    sendMessage("You have given " + otherPName + " a warning.");
                    p.sendMessage("You have been warned by "+ playerName +", you now have "+ warnings +" warnings.");
                    p.warnings += 1;
		p.savemoreinfo();
            }

}[/code]

Savemoreinfo:

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-warn = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(warnings), 0, Integer.toString(warnings).length());

Loadmoreinfo:

if (token.equals("character-warn")) { warnings = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

Post back and tell me if it works, I’ve just briefly written that up.[/quote]

You don’t need to add that part into process.

item.title: Need help with new idea
item.dc:creator: @Prima Prima
item.description:
@Prima wrote:

Declare:

public int warnings;

In process:

if (warnings >= 3) { appendToBanned(playerName); }

Command:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“warnplayer”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String otherPlayer = command.substring(8);
int otherPlayerIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPlayer);

	if (otherPlayerIndex != -1) {
		client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
                    sendMessage("You have given " + otherPName + " a warning.");
                    p.sendMessage("You have been warned by "+ playerName +", you now have "+ warnings +" warnings.");
                    p.warnings += 1;
		p.savemoreinfo();
            }

}[/code]

Savemoreinfo:

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-warn = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(warnings), 0, Integer.toString(warnings).length());

Loadmoreinfo:

if (token.equals("character-warn")) { warnings = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

Post back and tell me if it works, I’ve just briefly written that up.
